description: APPLICATION CONSISTS OF THE RETROSPECTIVE PLANNING APPLICATION FOR AN EXTENSION TO THE EXISTING MINI TREASURES NURSERY, WITHIN THE FORMER AIR CADET HALL AT THE ENTRANCE OF MORDEN HALL PARK AND GARDENS. THE PLANNING APPLICATION ALSO INCLUDES THE PROPOSAL TO CONSTRUCT A NEW OUTBUILDING IN PLACE OF TWO EXISTING OUTBUILDINGS, WHICH ARE TO BE DEMOLISHED. PROPOSED WORKS ARE WITHIN THE CURTILAGE OF THE WALLS OF WALLED GARDEN TO SOUTH OF MORDEN HALL, MORDEN HALL PARK, WHICH IS A LISTED STRUCTURE (GRADE II).
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 23MT/2/1/SITE/01 Rev 01; 23MT/2/2/GA/21 Rev 01; 23MT/2/3/GA/41 Rev 01; 23MT/2/3/GA/42 Rev 01; Site Location Plan.

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Condition:
Protection of the listed historic wall - The listed wall shall be protected against disturbance or damage from the single storey outbuilding. Any equipment within the nursery shall not be fixed or supported to the listed wall, or be positioned to be immediately abutting the listed wall, or the listed wall disturbed in any other way from the proposal.
Reason: 
In order to safeguard the special architectural or historic interest of the building and comply with Development Plan policies for Merton: policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021, policy CS14 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policy DMD4 of the Sites and Policies Plan

Condition : 5 - Condition:
The development hereby approved shall implement the flood mitigation measures as submitted with the proposal titled: EA FRA Matrix. These measures shall thereafter be retained in perpetuity 

Reason: 
To reduce the risk of flooding and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy SI 13 of the London Plan 2021, policy CS16 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policy DM F2 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 6 - Condition: Within 3 months of the date of this permission, a scheme identifying biodiversity/ecological enhancements to be achieved on the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved measures shall be implemented within 6 months of the date of this permission and retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the development mitigates against habitat loss and enhances biodiversity in accordance with London Plan policy G6, Merton's Core Strategy policy CS21 and Merton's Sites, Policies Plan policy DM O2

Condition : 7 - INFORMATIVE
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant was offered the opportunity to submit amended plans in order to make the proposal acceptable in planning terms.

Condition : 8 - INFORMATIVE

The applicant is reminded to not store any equipment against the listed wall.

Condition : 9 - INFORMATIVE:
Planning permission is not an overarching right to build and there may be other legal matters to consider including consent from the land owner
